questionListItems.title: How would I know when the HFE letter is issued to me?

answer.body:
You will be notified via SMS if you need to submit additional documents for our review, or when your HFE letter is ready. Log in to the HDB Flat Portal and follow these steps to:

View and upload the required documents:My Flat Dashboard > I am a new/resale flat buyer > Apply for an HFE letter (Step 2 of Buying Process) > Upload Documents
Check status of your HFE letter application/ view your HFE letter: My Flat Dashboard > I am a new/resale flat buyer > Apply for an HFE letter (Step 2 of Buying Process) > View Letter

questionListItems.title: After I have applied for an HFE letter, will I receive an acknowledgement from HDB?

answer.body:
Yes. There will be an acknowledgement page with the details of your application. You will be notified via SMS if you need to submit additional documents for our review, or when your HFE letter is ready. Log in to the HDB Flat Portal and follow these steps to:

View and upload the required documents:
Check status of your HFE letter application/ view your HFE letter:Select My Flat Dashboard > I am a new/resale flat buyer > Apply for an HFE letter (Step 2 of Buying Process) > Upload Documents

topics.title: Submission of an HFE letter application

questionListItems.title: Am I eligible to apply for a flat in this sales launch?

answer.body: You must have a valid HDB Flat Eligibility (HFE) letter before you can apply for a flat in our sales launches. The HFE letter will provide you with a holistic understanding of your housing and financing options before you embark on your home buying journey. It will inform you upfront of your eligibility to purchase a new or resale flat, as well as the amount of CPF housing grants and HDB housing loan you are eligible for.

questionListItems.title: When will I be notified of the ballot results? How will I be notified?

answer.body: You will receive an email notification to log in to the HDB Flat Portal to check the ballot results, within 2 months after the application period has closed. The timeline to release the ballot results is dependent on the sales launch and flat supply.

questionListItems.title: To submit Resale Application or Request for Value via the e-Resale system, what information do I need to log on?

answer.body: You will need to key in your NRIC number and your Singpass password.

questionListItems.title: For transactions involving Administrator/ Executor/ Public Trustee, whose SingPass should be used to submit the resale application?

answer.body: The person who is doing the submission via the e-Resale system will have to log in using his own NRIC number and Singpass.

questionListItems.title: How do I submit my resale application?

answer.body:
(i) At the (Online Submission of Resale Applications and Request for Value) page of the e-Resale system, choose 'Submit Resale Application'.

(ii) Log in using your NRIC number and Singpass.

(iii) Provide all the information requested in the application form.

(iv) Submit the resale application and make payment using Credit Card.

Buyers and sellers will have to submit their portions of the resale application separately. If you are the first party who has submitted his portion of the application, you should inform the second party so that he can submit his portion within seven days.

The resale application will only be considered complete when HDB receives both portions of the resale application from the buyer and the seller.

questionListItems.title: Can I request to extend the validity period of the HFE letter?

answer.body: The HFE letter is valid for 9 months from the date of issue and HDB is unable to extend its validity. If your HFE letter is expiring in the next 30 days and you need more time to secure an ideal home, you may apply for a fresh HFE letter if there are no changes in the applicant(s) and occupier(s) listed in the previous HFE letter application other than their employment or income. HDB will process your application based on your latest circumstances and the prevailing policies. Until a fresh HFE letter is issued, you may continue using the existing HFE letter for a flat purchased, as long as it has not expired.   Do note that if you have been shortlisted within 100% of the flat supply (for sales launches from Sep 2023 onwards) or you have already booked a flat, you do not need a fresh HFE letter. Hence, if you have applied for one, the HFE letter application will be cancelled. Find out more about the HFE letter.

questionListItems.title: What is a Letter of Offer?

answer.body: A Letter of Offer is an offer of a contract by a financial institution. It states the terms of the housing loan offered.

questionListItems.title: How do I know whether my request for Letter of Offer has been sent to the Financial Institutions (FIs)?

answer.body: The FIs will contact you on the outcome of your request for a Letter of Offer, or if they require more information. Log in to the HDB Flat Portal to check the status of your Letter of Offer and view the outcome (when ready) by selecting My Flat Dashboard > I am a new/resale flat buyer.

questionListItems.title: When is the next Build-To-Order (BTO), Sales of Balance Flats (SBF) sales exercise or open booking of flat?

answer.body:
You may refer to the HDB Flat Portal on the upcoming BTO exercise and inject of flat supply for open booking. A SBF exercise is launched on an ad-hoc basis when there are sufficient balance flats to be offered for sale.

You may subscribe to our HDB eAlert Service to receive notifications on our upcoming sales launches.

questionListItems.title: I have applied but want to change the town or flat type. How can I do it?

answer.body:
You must cancel your existing flat application and re-apply online during the application period with the payment of an administrative fee of $10 (inclusive of GST).

After the application period has closed, no changes are allowed.

questionListItems.title: How do I work out a budget for a flat purchase and finance the purchase?

answer.body:
The budget is based on your available funds to pay for the flat purchase, namely:

  • Amount of housing loan from HDB or a financial institution;
  • CPF savings in the Ordinary Account;
  • CPF housing grants (if eligible); and
  • Cash savings

Find out more on how you may budget for a flat purchase and use our financial tools to help you in the planning before you commit to a flat purchase.

questionListItems.title: What is subsidy recovery? When will it be recovered?

answer.body:
Subsidy recovery only applies to PLH flats. New PLH flats are priced with additional subsidies, on top of the significant subsidies already provided for BTO flats. Upon selling the flat^, you must return a percentage of the resale price* of the flat to HDB. The subsidy recovery percentage commensurate with the extent of the additional subsidy provided. Read more on PLH.

^ Not applicable to 2-room Flexi flats sold on short-lease.
* Where HDB assesses that a flat valuation is required, the subsidy recovery will be a percentage of the higher of the valuation and the resale price of the flat.

questionListItems.title: Is the helpdesk available 24 hours, 7 days a week?

answer.body: For assistance on resale policies and procedures, you may call the Sales/ Resale Customer Service Line at 1800-8663066 during office hours.
